page.title: 03Tankerville
page.content: There are five houses, two farms, a pottery and an Art Gallery. The village is situated around a dangerous sharp corner in a small dip. There are the remains of a{mine.}A red brick chimney still remains. Tankerville is an old street, it's about a hundred years old. It has bits of remains of houses. There is an old pond with lots of frogs. If you look down from the cliff or hill you can see the whole village. The{gallery,}run by Mr Fred Hollands, as well as offering for sale pictures of the local area, also teaches art to interested local people. The{pottery}is a cottage industry and its products are sold on site through a small shop. There is a very pleasant{walk}up alongside the Pottery, to a small waterfall,an ideal place for lunch.
